snippet: An annual homelessness report by the federal government found that New York’s homeless people accounted for 14 percent of the national total.
abstract: Housing and Urban Development Dept releases annual homelessness count that reveals increase in number of homeless New Yorkers, despite drop in number of homeless nationwide; count finds that around 75,323 people in city are living on streets or in shelters, 14 percent of total nationwide.
lead_paragraph: An annual homelessness report by the federal government found that New York’s homeless people accounted for 14 percent of the national total.

headline.main: New York’s Rise in Homelessness Went Against National Trend, U.S. Report Finds
headline.print_headline: Homelessness Rises in City, Resisting a U.S. Trend
